name.text: Finding the Surface Area of a Triangular Prism (Tent Problem)

questiontext.text:
A tent is shaped like a triangular prism. The triangular ends of the tent each have a base of \({@big_base@}\, \text{cm}\) and a height of \({@h@}\, \text{cm}\). The length of the tent is \({@l@}\, \text{cm}\). Calculate the total surface area of the tent’s canvas.

\(\text{Total surface area of the tent’s canvas}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}^2\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Given: A tent is shaped like a triangular prism with the following dimensions:

Base of right triangle \(={@b@}\,\text{m}\)
Height of triangle \(={@h@}\,\text{m}\)
Sloping side (hypotenuse) \(={@hyp@}\,\text{m}\)
Big base of tent \(={@big_base@}\,\text{m}\)
Length of tent \(={@l@}\,\text{m}\)

  1. Find the Total Surface Area of the Tent

    \(\textbf{Step 1. Find the area of one triangular end}\)

    \(\begin{align} A_{\triangle} &= \frac{1}{2} \times \text{base} \times \text{height} \\ &= \frac{1}{2} \times {@big_base@} \times {@h@} \\ &= {@area_triangle@}\,\text{m}^2 \end{align}\)

    \(\textbf{Step 2. Find the area of one rectangular side (the sloping panel)}\)

    \(\begin{align} A_{\text{rect}} &= \text{sloping side} \times \text{length} \\ &= {@hyp@} \times {@l@} \\ &= {@area_rectangle@}\,\text{m}^2 \end{align}\)

    \(\textbf{Step 3. Find the total surface area of the tent’s canvas}\)

    \(\begin{align} \text{Total Surface Area} &= 2(A_{\triangle}) + 2(A_{\text{rect}}) \\ &= 2({@area_triangle@}) + 2({@area_rectangle@}) \\ &= {@total_SA@}\,\text{m}^2 \end{align}\)

    \(\boxed{\text{Total Surface Area of the Tent’s Canvas} = {@final_answer@}\,\text{m}^2}\)

questionnote.text:
\(\text{The sides of the canvas, base, height and length of the tent are respectively } = {@big_base@},\, {@h@}, \,{@l@} \, \text{m}.\)

\(\text{The total surface area of the tent’s canvas } = {@total_SA @} \, \text{m}^2.\)
